text: <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in GBM cell apoptosis .

( A ) Full-length <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> possesses two N-terminal transactivation acidic domains , a proline-rich domain , a central DNA - binding region , and a C-terminal domain , containing a nuclear localization signal , an oligomerization domain , and a basic region .
N-terminal deletion mutants of <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are also shown .
( B ) Three likely scenarios are proposed for <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to regulate GBM cell death .
First , ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fails to induce apoptosis of GBM cells expressing endogenous wild type <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

It appears that ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds and functionally antagonizes <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and both proteins nullify each other 's function in inducing apoptosis .
Second , no physical interactions between mutant <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins and <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are expected in GBM cells .
Thus , ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce apoptosis in mutant <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing cells .
Finally , whether <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> isoforms is unknown .

Also , whether ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction of apoptosis in GBM cells expressing <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> isoforms remains to be established .
TAD , transactivation domain ; PrD , proline domain ; NLS , nuclear localization signal ; OD , oligomerization domain ; BR , basic region .
